subject: Law
title: Ambiguity and Contra Proferentem
description: Learn Ambiguity and Contra Proferentem in one minute.

hook.text: An insurance policy had a vague clause. The insurer wrote it. The court ruled against the insurer.

buildup.text: Contra proferentem means ambiguous terms are interpreted against the party who drafted them.

discovery.text: The logic: the drafter had the power to be clear. If they weren't, they bear the risk of ambiguity.

twist.text: It's most powerful in consumer contracts where one side had no ability to negotiate or clarify terms.

climax.text: Courts use it as a last resortâ€”only after other interpretation methods fail to resolve the ambiguity.

punchline.text: Write it vaguely, lose the argument. Clarity is self-defense.

quiz.question: What does contra proferentem mean?
options: Ambiguity is interpreted against the drafter
Both parties share the risk equally
